summary: Gale Lynn Oppenberg was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). Her name appears in multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from April 1978 to January 1979. These documents list her as an employee, including her salary and employment dates within the SCA. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on payroll indicates she was a staff member during the committee's investigation.
significance: Gale Lynn Oppenberg's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, albeit in an unspecified role. The payroll documents confirm her employment during the period the committee was actively investigating the assassination.
